org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine.storage.xmldb
Class AeAbstractXMLDBStorage

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine.storage.xmldb.AeXMLDBObject
      org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine.storage.xmldb.AeAbstractXMLDBStorage
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeXMLDBStorage
Direct Known Subclasses:
AeAbstractTaminoStorageEx, AeAbstractXMLDBStorageConnection, AeAbstractXMLDBStorageProvider, AeXMLDBJournalStorage, AeXMLDBLogReader, AeXMLDBLogStreamReader.AeXMLDBLogAccessor, AeXMLDBValidator.AeXMLDBValidatorStorage
public abstract class AeAbstractXMLDBStorage
extends AeXMLDBObject
implements IAeXMLDBStorage

A base class for all XMLDB storage objects. This class provides convenience methods for querying, deleting, updating, and inserting document instances.

                                 IAeXMLDBResponseHandler aResponseHandler)
                          throws AeXMLDBException
Queries the XMLDB by creating a query builder and using it to generate an XQuery. The query builder to use is created by FIXMEQ (xmldb) use this query() variant for all query-builder based queries - then make the above method private

insertDocument

protected long insertDocument(java.lang.String aXMLPatternKey,
                              java.lang.Object[] aParams)
                       throws AeXMLDBException
Inserts a document instance into the XMLDB database. This version of the method takes an XML 'pattern' which is a Java MessageFormat formatted string. This string, along with the included parameters, will become valid XML when formatted.

Parameters:
aXMLPatternKey - a key into the xmldb config
aParams -
Throws:
AeXMLDBException

createDocInstance

protected java.lang.String createDocInstance(java.lang.String aDocTypeKey,
                                             java.util.Map aParams)
                                      throws AeXMLDBException
Creates a doc instance given the doc type key and parameter map. TODO It would be nice if this returned a Reader so we didn't have to serialize to String before handing off to XMLDB...

Parameters:
aDocTypeKey -
aParams -
Throws:
AeXMLDBException

insertDocument

protected long insertDocument(java.lang.String aDocTypeKey,
                              java.util.LinkedHashMap aParams)
                       throws AeXMLDBException
Inserts a document instance into the XMLDB database. This version of the method takes a key into the XMLDB Config. The key should resolve to a String which will be the name of the document instance (the doc type) and thus the name of the root XML element. The map of parameters should be String->Object. The keys of the map will be the names of Elements in the doc instance and the values will be the Element values. If order is important a LinkedHashMap should be used when calling this method. Different Java types for the values of the parameters will be handled appropriately (QName will be handled/inserted as an AeQName, for example).

Parameters:
aDocTypeKey -
aParams -
Throws:
AeXMLDBException

insertDocument

protected long insertDocument(java.lang.String aDocTypeKey,
                              java.util.LinkedHashMap aParams,
                              IAeXMLDBConnection aConnection)
                       throws AeXMLDBException
Inserts a document instance into the XMLDB database. This version of the method takes a key into the XMLDB Config. The key should resolve to a String which will be the name of the document instance (the doc type) and thus the name of the root XML element. The map of parameters should be String->Object. The keys of the map will be the names of Elements in the doc instance and the values will be the Element values. If order is important a LinkedHashMap should be used when calling this method. Different Java types for the values of the parameters will be handled appropriately (QName will be handled/inserted as an AeQName, for example).

Parameters:
aDocTypeKey -
aParams -
aConnection -
Throws:
AeXMLDBException

createDocInstanceElement

protected AeFastElement createDocInstanceElement(java.lang.String aElementName,
                                                 java.lang.Object aValue)
Creates the content element to be inserted into a document instance with the given Object content. This method will return a different Element depending on the type of the Object passed. For example, it will create an Element of type AeQName if the Object passed in is a QName.

Parameters:
aElementName -
aValue -

insertDocument

protected long insertDocument(java.lang.String aXMLPatternKey,
                              java.lang.Object[] aParams,
                              IAeXMLDBConnection aConnection)
                       throws AeXMLDBException
Inserts a document instance into the XMLDB database. This version of the method takes an XML 'pattern' which is a Java MessageFormat formatted string. This string, along with the included parameters, will become valid XML when formatted. This version of the method also includes the XMLDB connection that should be used to do the insert.

Parameters:
aXMLPatternKey - a key into the xmldb config
aParams -
aConnection -
Throws:
AeXMLDBException

insertDocument

protected long insertDocument(org.w3c.dom.Element aElem)
                       throws AeXMLDBException
Inserts a document instance into the XMLDB database. Returns the ino:id of the inserted document. This ID is an auto-increment value that can be used to refer to or delete the inserted document.

Parameters:
aElem -
Throws:
AeXMLDBException

deleteDocuments

protected int deleteDocuments(AeXMLDBQueryBuilder aBuilder)
                       throws AeXMLDBException
Deletes some documents that are selected using a query builder. The query builder uses a filter to generate an XQuery that is used to delete the documents.

Parameters:
aBuilder -
Throws:
AeXMLDBException

deleteDocuments

protected int deleteDocuments(AeXMLDBQueryBuilder aBuilder,
                              IAeXMLDBConnection aConnection)
                       throws AeXMLDBException
Deletes some documents that are selected using a query builder. The query builder uses a filter to generate an XQuery that is used to delete the documents. This version uses the included IAeXMLDBConnection to execute the query.

Parameters:
aBuilder -
aConnection -
Throws:
AeXMLDBException

deleteDocumentsInternal

                                    java.lang.String aDeleteDocType,
                                    IAeXMLDBConnection aConnection)
                             throws AeXMLDBException
Deletes a set of documents based on the given query. Returns the number of documents deleted. If the aDeleteDocType param is not null, then the return value reflects the total number of doc instances of that type that were deleted.
